scientific_basis: This quiz is inspired by self-expansion theory, which suggests that couples grow closer by sharing new and exciting experiences together.
description: Ready to spice up your relationship? Take this quiz to find out how adventurous you and your partner are, and uncover new ways to have fun and grow together!

questions.question: When planning a weekend together, what do you prefer to do?
options: Stick to our usual routine and relax at home.
Try a new restaurant or visit a new place in town.
Plan a spontaneous road trip without a set destination.
Participate in a planned activity like a workshop or class.
Take turns deciding each activity to keep things unpredictable.

questions.question: How do you feel about trying a new hobby as a couple?
options: I'd rather stick to hobbies we already enjoy.
I'm open to trying something new if it interests me.
Excited! Let's dive into something completely different.
I prefer one of us tries something new while the other stays the same.
Let's explore a few options and see what excites us both.

questions.question: Your partner suggests an adventurous date, like hiking or kayaking. How do you respond?
options: I'd prefer a more relaxed date instead.
I'm open to it if I've never tried it before.
Absolutely! I love outdoor adventures.
I'd join but might feel a bit out of my comfort zone.
I'd be excited to try something new together.

questions.question: How often do you seek out new experiences together?
options: Rarely, we enjoy our regular activities.
Occasionally, when something interesting comes up.
Frequently, we love exploring new things.
Only when one of us suggests it.
We actively look for new experiences all the time.

questions.question: When faced with a new opportunity, how do you decide to participate as a couple?
options: We discuss it thoroughly before deciding.
One of us usually takes the lead in deciding.
We jump in and see how it goes.
We consider how it fits into our schedules first.
We evaluate how it can benefit our relationship.

questions.question: How do you handle uncertainty when trying something new together?
options: We might feel anxious but try to support each other.
We prefer to avoid uncertain situations.
We embrace the uncertainty as part of the adventure.
One of us might hesitate while the other encourages.
We communicate openly to navigate the uncertainty together.

questions.question: What role does spontaneity play in your relationship?
options: We prefer planned activities over spontaneous ones.
Sometimes it's fun, but not a priority.
It's a key part of how we connect and have fun.
It happens occasionally when the mood strikes.
We thrive on spontaneous adventures and surprises.

questions.question: How do you celebrate milestones or special occasions?
options: We stick to traditional celebrations we're comfortable with.
We try something slightly different each time.
We plan unique and adventurous activities.
We let the moment guide how we celebrate.
We combine both familiar and new elements to celebrate.

questions.question: When traveling, what is your preferred style as a couple?
options: Relaxing and visiting familiar places.
Exploring new cities and cultures.
Engaging in adventurous activities like trekking or diving.
A mix of sightseeing and spontaneous activities.
Trying unconventional modes of travel and unique experiences.

questions.question: How important is it for you and your partner to grow through new experiences?
options: It's not very important; we're happy as we are.
Somewhat important, but not a priority.
Very important, it helps us stay connected.
Important, as long as it's comfortable for both.
Crucial, as it strengthens our bond and personal growth.

evaluation_method.explanation: Each answer corresponds to a different adventure-seeking style based on self-expansion theory. Your responses are categorized into five styles: Cautious Explorers, Open Adventurers, Thrill Seekers, Balanced Explorers, and Dynamic Duo. Tally your answers to see which style best describes your relationship.
evaluation_method.example: For example, choosing more 'A' options might indicate a Cautious Explorer style, while more 'C' options suggest you and your partner are Thrill Seekers.

mostly_A.label: Cautious Explorers
mostly_A.description: You and your partner enjoy stability and prefer familiar activities. While you may not seek out new adventures often, your consistent approach provides a strong foundation for your relationship.
mostly_A.advice: Consider gradually introducing new activities to add a spark of excitement. Small changes can enhance your connection without overwhelming either of you.

mostly_B.label: Open Adventurers
mostly_B.description: You're open to new experiences and willing to try different things as a couple. This flexibility helps keep your relationship dynamic and engaging.
mostly_B.advice: Keep exploring new hobbies and interests together. Your openness will continue to strengthen your bond and bring fresh energy into your relationship.

mostly_C.label: Thrill Seekers
mostly_C.description: Adventure and excitement are central to your relationship. You love diving into new and exhilarating experiences together, keeping the relationship vibrant and lively.
mostly_C.advice: Ensure you balance thrill-seeking with moments of relaxation. While adventures are exciting, taking time to unwind together can provide a well-rounded relationship.

mostly_D.label: Balanced Explorers
mostly_D.description: You strike a healthy balance between trying new things and maintaining your regular routines. This equilibrium helps in sustaining both excitement and comfort in your relationship.
mostly_D.advice: Continue to balance your activities, mixing new adventures with familiar comforts. This approach will help you grow together while maintaining stability.

mostly_E.label: Dynamic Duo
mostly_E.description: You and your partner are highly proactive in seeking out new and unique experiences. Your relationship thrives on continuous growth and shared adventures.
mostly_E.advice: Keep embracing new challenges and opportunities together. Your proactive approach ensures that your relationship remains strong and ever-evolving.
